name: Harvard
content1: Harvard University is the oldest institution of higher education in the United States. It was founded in 1636 and named after John Harvard, who left his library and half his estate to the institution when he died.
content2: Harvard's library system is the largest academic library in the world, with over 20 million volumes in its collections. The library is made up of over 70 individual libraries, including the Widener Library, which is the university's flagship library and one of the largest libraries in the world.
content3: Harvard has produced more U.S. presidents than any other university. Eight U.S. presidents have graduated from Harvard, including John Adams, John Quincy Adams, Theodore Roosevelt, Franklin D. Roosevelt, John F. Kennedy, George W. Bush, Barack Obama, and most recently, Joe Biden.

name: PHP
content1: PHP was originally an acronym for Personal Home Page Tools
content2: PHP was originally created as a set of Common Gateway Interface (CGI) scripts for tracking visitors to a personal website of Rasmus Lerdorf, a Danish-Canadian programmer, in 1994. Lerdorf later released the scripts as open source, and other developers contributed to their development, leading to the creation of the PHP language we know today.
content3: PHP is used by many popular websites and content management systems (CMS), including Facebook, Wikipedia, WordPress, and Joomla. In fact, according to the W3Techs survey, PHP is used by 78.9% of all websites with a known server-side programming language

name: About Animals
content1: Some species of birds, such as pigeons and homing pigeons, have the ability to detect Earth's magnetic field and use it to navigate during migration. This ability is thought to be linked to the presence of tiny crystals of magnetite in the birds' beaks, which can act as a magnetic compass
content2: The common octopus has an incredible ability to change the color and texture of its skin to match its surroundings, making it almost invisible to predators. It can do this by contracting and expanding specialized skin cells called chromatophores, which contain pigments that can be manipulated to produce different colors and patterns.
content3: The blue whale is the largest animal on Earth, and also the loudest. Its calls have been recorded at up to 188 decibels, making it louder than a jet engine and even louder than the loudest rock concerts. Despite this, the calls can travel for hundreds of miles underwater, allowing blue whales to communicate with each other over long distances.

name: About my family
content1: The Simpsons is the longest-running American sitcom and the longest-running American animated program in history
content2: The character of Marge Simpson was originally designed with rabbit ears
content3: The character of Apu, the Kwik-E-Mart clerk, was originally voiced by actor Hank Azaria

name: Pitch for Kids Books
content1: The Adventures of the Curious Caterpillar - This book could follow the journey of a young caterpillar who sets out to explore the world and learns important lessons along the way.
content2: The Mystery of the Missing Toy - In this book, a group of animal friends work together to solve the mystery of a missing toy and discover the importance of teamwork and problem-solving.
content3: The Magic Garden - This book could tell the story of a young girl who discovers a secret garden filled with magical plants and creatures, and learns to appreciate the beauty and wonder of nature.

name: My Sensitive Data
content1: Step 1 - Figure out how to change the World.
content2: Step 2 - Detail a comprehensive plan on how to make the World better.
content3: Step 3 - Forget to click on the share checkbox to left people know.

name: Fun Facts About Schools
content1: The first formal school in the world was the University of Bologna in Italy, which was founded in 1088.
content2: In the United States, the first public high school was Boston Latin School, which was established in 1635.
content3: The largest school in the world is the City Montessori School in Lucknow, India. It has over 55,000 students and more than 4,000 teachers.

name: Harvard Extension School
content1: Harvard Extension School's computer science courses are taught by experienced industry professionals who bring real-world knowledge and expertise to the classroom..
content2: Harvard Extension School offers a variety of programming courses.
content3: Harvard Extension School's programming courses are designed to be flexible and accessible, with online and on-campus options available.

name: Harvard Fun
content1: Harvard is the oldest institution of higher education in the United States, founded in 1636.
content2: Harvard has produced more U.S. presidents than any other university.
content3: Harvard has the largest academic library in the world.

name: Harvard More Fun
content1: Harvard's official color is crimson.
content2: Harvard has a number of famous alumni.
content3: Some well-known Harvard alumni include Barack Obama, Bill Gates, Mark Zuckerberg, and Natalie Portman.

name: Cambridge
content1: Cambridge is home to two of the world's most prestigious universities.
content2: Cambridge is known for being a hub for innovation and entrepreneurship.
content3: Cambridge is a 10 hour drive from Toronto.

name: More About Cambridge
content1: The city is named after the University of Cambridge in England.
content2: Cambridge has a diverse population and is known for being a liberal and progressive city.
content3: Cambridge is home to a number of cultural institutions.

name: Toronto
content1: Toronto is the largest city in Canada and fourth largest city in North America.
content2: Toronto is one of the most multicultural cities in the world, with over half of its population born outside of Canada.
content3: Toronto is home to the CN Tower, one of the tallest freestanding structures in the world.

name: Summer Vacation
content1: The concept of summer vacation can be traced back to the early 20th century in the United States.
content2: In the United States, summer vacation typically lasts between 10 and 12 weeks.
content3: Summer vacation is celebrated in different ways around the world.

name: Computers
content1: The first computer program was created by Ada Lovelace.
content2: he ENIAC (Electronic Numerical Integrator and Computer), was built in 1945 and weighed over 27 tons.
content3: The world's first website was created by Tim Berners-Lee.

name: The Internet
content1: The first message ever sent over the internet was LO in 1969.
content2: The original internet proposal was for a system that could help scientists at CERN, the European Organization for Nuclear Research, share and access information more easily.
content3: The first webcam was created in 1991 by computer scientists at the University of Cambridge to monitor the coffee machine.

name: GPT
content1: GPT stands for Generative Pre-trained Transformer.
content2: GPT-3 has over 175 billion parameters.
content3: GPT-3 has been used to create a wide range of applications, from chatbots and virtual assistants to automated content creation and even generating computer code.

name: Laravel Fun Facts
content1: Laravel was created by Taylor Otwell in 2011.
content2: The name Laravel comes from the French word for the blade.
content3: The Artisan CLI includes commands for everything from generating code and managing databases to running tests and optimizing performance.

name: More Laravel Fun Facts
content1: Laravel has a built-in task scheduler.
content2: One of the most popular features of Laravel is its built-in support for testing.
content3: Laravel has a vibrant community of developers and enthusiasts.

name: Still More Laravel
content1: Laravel is open-source software and is distributed under the terms of the MIT License.
content2: Laravel is built on top of several popular PHP components.
content3: Laravel has a strong focus on security. The framework includes built-in protection against common security threats like cross-site scripting (XSS) and cross-site request forgery (CSRF) attacks.
